title: Nurses Strike For Better Ebola Preparedness
teaser: Up to 18,000 Kaiser Permanente nurses in California are timing their strike to coincide with nurse protests across the nation.
contentencoded:
Up to 18,000 Kaiser Permanente nurses in California are picketing outside medical centers and clinics on the second day of a two-day strike over wages and benefits.

They’ve timed their strike to coincide with nurse protests across the country today, in a “National Day of Action,” over what nurses say is a widespread lack of Ebola preparedness at hospitals.

April Dembosky, health reporter for The California Report on KQED, tells Here & Now’s Robin Young that the nurses strike in California is focused onÂ filling more than 2,000 nursing positions that have been vacated in the last three years, better protections for use of sick leave or more flexibility over breaks and more training and education.
